ygData.subject: AList questions
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello again, this time I am trying to understand the AList implementation. I have three questions: 1. Is there any special reason why you use a Hashtable

Subject: AList questions
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=214587980

Hello again,

this time I am trying to understand the AList implementation.=
 I have three 
questions:

1. Is there any special reason why you use a Has=
htable instead of a HashMap? 
Do we need Hashtable's internal synchronizati=
on?

2. Is it necessary to throw NoSuchElementExceptions when a key is not =

contained in the table? This usually makes an additional "containsKey" cal=
l 
necessary (like in the logging classes). Could you perhaps add extra get=
ter 
methods without this check?

3. Why are these classes outside the org.=
archive package tree (in 
"st.ata.util")?


Best regards,
-- 
Christian Koh=
lsch=FCtter
L3S Research Center

http://www.l3s.de/~kohlschuetter/
